properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 11 at 2:23AM EST until February 11 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Charleston WV
properties.description:
At 223 AM EST, As of near 2 AM EST, the stage of Middle Island Creek
near Middlebourne had crested near 16.5 feet. The estimated flood
stage is 16 feet. The creek is expected to slowly fall overnight. At
stages near 16 feet, fields and low and poor drainage areas along
the creek and associated tributaries begin to flood. In addition,
the higher water levels downstream on the Middle Island Creek
appeared to be near crest at Little, near 13,7 feet, just below its
14 foot flood stage. The creek is expected to begin slowly falling
overnight. At stages near 14 feet, the lower fields begin to flood
and Stewarts Run Road becomes flooded.

Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Middlebourne, Little, and other low and poor drainage areas along
and near Middle Island Creek..

This includes the following streams and drainages...
Gorrell Run, Walnut Fork, Middle Island Creek, McElroy Creek,
Buffalo Run, Muddy Creek, Conaway Run, Indian Run, Hills Run,
Wheeler Run, Dry Run, Jefferson Run, Big Run, Woodburn Run and
Saltlick Run.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by
calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may
also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston
West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using
the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING FOR CENTRAL TYLER COUNTY
